states.eligibility: Eligibility to register      Be a U.S. citizen.   Be an Alabama resident.   Be at least 18 years old.   NOT been convicted of a disqualifying felony.   NOT be declared mentally incompetent by a court.
states.online: Items required: Valid Alabama driver's license or identification card . To register to vote online, Visit the state's Electronic Voter Registration Application and follow the prompts as you complete the online form.
states.inPerson: Items required: Valid Alabama driver's license or identification card . To register to vote online, Obtain State of Alabama Mail-In Voter Registration Form (Form NVRA-2) by mail by filling out the online form request, printing it out here, or by calling (800) 274-8683. Complete State of Alabama Mail-In Voter Registration Form (Form NVRA-2). Return form to your local AL county office of Board of Registrars an AL DMV driver licensing office when you apply for or renew your driver's license or ID card any other government agency such as Medicaid agencies, Department of Human Resources, County public library.
states.mail: Items required: Valid Alabama driver's license or identification card . To register to vote online, Obtain State of Alabama Mail-In Voter Registration Form (Form NVRA-2) by mail by filling out the online form request, printing it out here, or by calling (800) 274-8683. Complete State of Alabama Mail-In Voter Registration Form (Form NVRA-2). Return form to your local AL county office of Board of Registrars
states.absentee: Items required:      Item     . To register to vote online,       step1

states.eligibility: Eligibility to register    Be a U.S. citizen.  Be a resident of Alaska.  Be at least 18 years old, or within 90 days of turning 18 years old.  NOT convicted and currently serving incarceration, parole, probation for a disqualifying felony*.  NOT be registered to vote in another state.
states.online: Items required: Valid Alaska driver's license or ID card . To register to vote online, Visit the state's Online Voter Registration System. and follow the prompts asyou complete the online form.
states.inPerson: Items required: Valid Alaska driver's license or ID card . To register to vote online, Register to vote or update your registration in person at aDivision of Elections Office, or visit avoter registration agency in your area.
states.mail: Items required: Valid Alaska driver's license or ID card . To register to vote online, Print a paper form to complete and sign. Send your completed form by mail, fax or email attachment to aRegional Elections Office. Send a copy of either your current driver’s license, state ID, passportor birth certificate with your paper form.
states.absentee: coming soon

states.eligibility: Eligibility to register      Be a U.S. citizen.   Be a resident of the Arizona county listed on your registration.   Be at least 18 years old on or before the date of the next general election.   NOT disqualified from voting at this time due to felony conviction(s).   NOT be declared 'incompetent' by a court.   Must register to vote at least 29 days before the next election to be able to vote in it.
states.online: Items required: Name, as it appears on your driver's license or ID card. Address Social Security number. . To register to vote online, Visit the state's Electronic Voter Registration Application and follow the prompts as you complete the online form.
states.inPerson: Items required: Proof of your U.S. citizenship, such as a photocopy of your birth certificate or U.S. passport. . To register to vote online, Pick up an Arizona Voter Registration Form form at your local County Recorder, or print it out here Complete the form. Return the form and your proof of U.S. citizenship to your local County Recorder. You can also register to vote at your local AZ MVD office when you apply for an Arizona driver's license or identification card.
states.mail: Items required: Proof of your U.S. citizenship, such as a photocopy of your birth certificate or U.S. passport. . To register to vote online, Print the Arizona Voter Registration Form Complete the form. Mail the form and your proof of U.S. citizenship to your local County Recorder.
states.absentee: coming soon

states.eligibility: Eligibility to register     Be a U.S. citizen.   Be an Arkansas resident (residing in Arkansas at least 30 days prior to the first election in which you will vote).   Be age 18 or turn 18 on or before the next election.   Not be a convicted felon whose sentence has not been discharged or pardoned.   Not be presently adjudged as mentally incompetent as to your ability to vote by a court of competent jurisdiction.
states.online: none
states.inPerson: Items required:      Valid Arkansas driver's license or identification card     . To register to vote online,     You can complete an in-person voter registration at:      Your county clerk's office.   Any AR ODS location where you complete a paper form or have your information sent electronically.   Any public library or Arkansas State Library.   Any public assistance or disability agency.   Any military recruitment or National Guard office.   Local voter registration drives.
states.mail: Items required: Valid Arkansas driver's license or identification card, or A copy of a current utility bill, bank statement, government check or paycheck that shows your name and address, or Another government document that shows your name and address . To register to vote online, Obtain Arkansas Voter Registration Application from your local county clerk's office, from the Arkansas Secretary of State, by calling the Secretary of State Elections Division at (800) 247-3312, by filling out the online form request, printing it out here. Complete the form Mail in the form on the address provided in the paper application.
states.absentee: coming soon

states.eligibility: Eligibility to register      Be a U.S. citizen.   A California resident.   18 years old or older on Election Day.   Not currently in prison or on parole for a felony conviction. Note that Some citizens serving certain legal sentences can vote, and those with felony convictions who've had their civil rights restored can vote.   Not found to be mentally incompetent by a court.
states.online: Items required: Your California driver license or California identification card number The last four digits of your social security number Your date of birth . To register to vote online, Visit the California Online Voter Registration and follow the prompts as you complete the online form.
states.inPerson: none
states.mail: Items required: California driver's license or identification card number Last 4 digits of your social security number . To register to vote online, Obtain National Mail Voter Registration Form by printing it here, pick a registration form up at your local DMV office or county elections office, or request one by calling the voter hotline at (800) 345-8683. Complete the form. Mail the form to the address provided on the application.
states.absentee: coming soon

states.eligibility: Eligibility to register      Be a U.S. citizen.   A Colorado resident who has lived in the state for at least 22 days before the election in which you plan to vote.   At least 18 years old by the date of the next election.   NOT currently serving a sentence of confinement, detention, or parole for a felony conviction.
states.online: Items required: A valid Colorado driver's license, or A Colorado ID card issued by the DMV. . To register to vote online, Visit the state's Electronic Voter Registration Application and follow the prompts as you complete the online form.
states.inPerson: Items required:      Valid Colorado driver's license or identification card     . To register to vote online,     You can complete an in-person voter registration at:      Your county clerk's office.   A Colorado DMV office when you apply for or renew your driver's license.   Public assistance offices.   Military recruitment offices.   Voter service and polling centers.
states.mail: Items required: Valid Colorado driver's license or identification card . To register to vote online, Print the Colorado Voter Registration Form* (Form 100) here, or pick up this form directly from your county clerk's office. Complete the form. Return form to your county clerk's office
states.absentee: coming soon

states.eligibility: Eligibility to register      Be a U.S. citizen.   A resident of Connecticut.   At least 17 years old to register, and must be 18 years old on or before Election Day.   NOT be imprisoned or on parole. Voting rights are automatically restored upon the release of incarceration and, if applicable, parole.
states.online: Items required: Valid CT driver's license, permit, or photo ID card, and a signature on file with the DMV. . To register to vote online, Visit the state's Online Voter Registration System and follow the prompts as you complete the online form.
states.inPerson: Items required: Valid CT driver's license, permit, or photo ID card . To register to vote online, Obtain State of Connecticut Mail-In Voter Registration (Form ED-671 S) here Complete the form. Return form to your local town hall or voter registration office. Locations found here
states.mail: Items required: Valid CT driver's license, permit, or photo ID card . To register to vote online, Obtain State of Connecticut Mail-In Voter Registration (Form ED-671 S) here Complete the form. Mail form to your local town hall or voter registration office. Address found here
states.absentee: coming soon

states.eligibility: Eligibility to register      Be a U.S. citizen.   You're a Delaware citizen.   You're at least 18 years old.   You have not been deemed mentally incompetent.   You have not committed a disqualifying felony.   If applicable, you are no longer incarcerated, on parole, or on probation.
states.online: none
states.inPerson: Items required: Valid Delaware driver's license or photo ID card Proof of residency via current utility bill, bank statement, or government paystub. . To register to vote online, You can complete an in-person voter registration at: your local Department of Elections Your local Delaware DMV office if you're applying, renewing, or updating your DE driver's license or state ID card. Department of Health and Social Services. Department of Labor.
states.mail: Items required: Delaware driver's license or ID number. If you have neither, provide your Social Security number. . To register to vote online, Visit the state's Online Voter Registration System to complete a voter registration form online Print, sign, and mail the application to the address provided. If you have never registered before, you must provide copies of proof of photo identification OR proof of residency that shows your name and address with your application; otherwise, you must provide them the first time you vote in a Federal election.
states.absentee: coming soon

states.eligibility: Eligibility to register      Be a U.S. citizen.   Be a Florida resident.   Be at least 18 years old. You can pre-register to vote at 16 years old, but you'll need to wait until you're 18 years old to vote.   Have never been legally judged ineligible to vote, for either mental incapacitation or crime.   Have not been convicted of a felony and had your civil rights restored.   Must register at least 29 days before an election to be able to vote.
states.online: none
states.inPerson: Items required: Valid Florida Driver License or Florida identification Card Number . To register to vote online, Print Florida Voter Registration Application (Form DS-DE 39) here Complete the form. Return form to the following: your local county Supervisor of Elections A FLHSMV driver's license office. A voter registration agency. An armed forces recruitment office. Any public library.
states.mail: Items required: Valid Florida Driver License or Florida identification Card Number . To register to vote online, Print Florida Voter Registration Application (Form DS-DE 39) here Complete the form. Mail form to your local county Supervisor of Elections. Addresses found here
states.absentee: coming soon

states.eligibility: Eligibility to register      Be a U.S. citizen.   Legal resident of a Georgia county.   At least 17 1/2 years old. You must be 18 years old before or on Election Day.   Have not been deemed by a judge to be mentally incompetent.   Not incarcerated, on parole or on probation for a felony conviction.
states.online: Items required: Valid Georgia driver's license or ID card. . To register to vote online, Visit the state's Online Voter Registration System and follow the prompts as you complete the online form.
states.inPerson: Items required:      Valid Georgia driver's license or ID card.     . To register to vote online,       Go to the Georgia Department of Driver Services (DDS) when you apply for your GA driver's license or renew your GA driver's license.
states.mail: Items required: Valid Georgia driver's license or ID card. . To register to vote online, Obtain the State of Georgia Application for Voter Registration from Downloading the form here Your county board of registrar's office, or The public library, or Public assistance offices, or Colleges and universities, or Other government offices, or Complete the form. Mail the application to the address on the form.
states.absentee: coming soon

states.eligibility: Eligibility to register      Be a U.S. citizen.   A Hawaii resident   You're at least 18 years old, or will be at the time of election. You can pre-register at 16 years old, but you can't actually vote until you turn 18 years old.   NOT be currently incarcerated   If you are a felon, your sentence must have been suspended, regardless of whether you're placed on probation, or you've been paroled after completing their imprisonment.
states.online: Items required: Your current Hawaii Driver's License or Hawaii State ID card Your Social Security Number . To register to vote online, Visit the state's Online Voter Registration System and follow the prompts as you complete the online form.
states.inPerson: Items required: Proof of photo identification such as your Hawaii driver's license or ID card, or Document that show both your name and address such as current utility bill, current bank statement, current government or other paycheck. . To register to vote online, Obtain the Voter Registration and Permanent Absentee Form from Downloading the form here Public libraries, or City halls, or Phone directories, or U.S. post offices, or University of Hawaii systems, or Register in person at any city or county clerks office or at the Office of Elections location Complete the form. Return it to the county elections offices listed on the application.
states.mail: Items required: Proof of photo identification such as your Hawaii driver's license or ID card, or Document that show both your name and address such as current utility bill, current bank statement, current government or other paycheck. . To register to vote online, Obtain the Voter Registration and Permanent Absentee Form from Downloading the form here Public libraries, or City halls, or Phone directories, or U.S. post offices, or University of Hawaii systems Complete the form. Mail it to the county elections offices listed on the application.
states.absentee: coming soon

states.eligibility: Eligibility to register      Be a U.S. citizen.   Have resided in Idaho and in the county for thirty (30) days prior to the day of election   Be at least 18 years old   You have not been convicted of a felony and have had your civil rights restored.
states.online: none
states.inPerson: Items required: A copy of a current and valid photo identification or a copy of a current utility bill, bank statement, government check, paycheck or government document that shows your name and address must be submitted with this form or shown at the polls prior to voting . To register to vote online, You can register at the polls on Election Day if you bring proof of ID and Idaho residency, or Obtain Idaho Voter Registration Form (Form ERM-1) here Complete the form. Return form to the applicable county election office listed on the application.
states.mail: Items required: A copy of a current and valid photo identification or a copy of a current utility bill, bank statement, government check, paycheck or government document that shows your name and address must be submitted with this form or shown at the polls prior to voting . To register to vote online, Obtain Idaho Voter Registration Form (Form ERM-1) here Complete the form. Mail form to the applicable county election office listed on the application.

states.eligibility: Eligibility to register      Be a U.S. citizen.   You must be 17 years old on or before the date of the Primary Election and turn 18 on or before the date of the General Election.   You must live in your election precinct at least 30 days prior to Election Day.   Not be convicted and in jail.   Not claim the right to vote anywhere else.
states.online: Items required: Your Illinois Drivers License or Illinois State ID number. Date the license or ID was issued. The last four digits of your social security number. Online Voter Registration System and follow the prompts as you complete the online form.
states.inPerson: Items required:      Valid Illinois Drivers License or Illinois State ID number and 2 documents proving identification. 1 document must show your current address, or   The last 4 digits of your SSN and a valid photo identification, and a copy of a document proving your residential address      . To register to vote online,     You can register to vote in person at:      Board of Election Commissioner's Office.   County Clerk's Office   City and Village Offices.   Military Recruitment Offices.   Township Offices.   Schools   Public Libraries.
states.mail: Items required: Valid Illinois Drivers License or Illinois State ID number and 2 documents proving identification. 1 document must show your current address, or The last 4 digits of your SSN and a valid photo identification, and a copy of a document proving your residential address . To register to vote online, Obtain Illinois Voter Registration Application (Form SBE R-19) here Complete the form. Mail form to your local election authority. Address found here

states.eligibility: Eligibility to register      You are both a U.S. citizen and a resident of Indiana.   You will be at least 18 years of age on or before the next General or Municipal Election.   You are not currently in prison after being convicted of a crime.   You have lived in the precinct where you vote for at least 30 days prior to the election
states.online: Items required: valid Indiana driver’s license Indiana state-issued identification card (In lieu of drivers license) . To register to vote online, Visit this website Fillout the online registration form above
states.inPerson: Items required: State voter registration form (VRG-7) County voter registration form (VRG-11) . To register to vote online, Download and fillout this form Return the completed form to your county’s voter registration office or the Indiana Election Division. You can also apply in person at the voter registration or county clerk’s office, or apply in person at any BMV license branch. Once you registration form is received it will be processed. If the form is accepted a voter registration acknowledgment card will be sent to your address. If the form is denied a notice will be sent to your address.
states.mail: Items required: State voter registration form (VRG-7) County voter registration form (VRG-11) . To register to vote online, Download and fillout this form Return the completed form to your county’s voter registration office or the Indiana Election Division using the mailing addresses on the form. Once you registration form is received it will be processed. If the form is accepted a voter registration acknowledgment card will be sent to your address. If the form is denied a notice will be sent to your address.
states.absentee: Items required:      Item     . To register to vote online,       step1

states.eligibility: Eligibility to register      Be a U.S. citizen.   Be a resident of Iowa.   Be at least 17 1/2 years old. You must be at least 18 years old by the election date to be able to vote.   NOT be registered to vote in any other state.   NOT be incarcerated, on parole, on probation, or have outstanding monetary obligations from your felony conviction.   NOT be judged mentally incompetent to vote by a court.
states.online: Items required: valid Iowa driver’s license or ID number . To register to vote online, Visit this website Fillout the online registration form.
states.inPerson: Items required: Registration form. . To register to vote online, Download this form. Bring the form to your county auditor’s office. Please note that the form must be signed. Your county auditor will send you a voter registration card within two weeks if the form is accepted. Pre-registration must be completed 10 days before general elections or 11 days before all other elections.
states.mail: Items required: Registration form. . To register to vote online, Download this form. Mail the form to your county auditor’s office. Please note that the form must be signed. Your county auditor will send you a voter registration card within two weeks if the form is accepted. Pre-registration must be completed 10 days before general elections or 11 days before all other elections. Additionally you can register at the polls on election day if you an Iowa drivers license or the following forms of ID. Iowa non-driver ID card Out-of-state driver's license or non-driver ID card U.S. passport U.S. military ID ID card issued by employer Student ID issued by Iowa high school or college If that form does not include an address you will need a proof of residence such as the following: Residential lease Utility bill (including a cell phone bill) Bank statement Paycheck Government check or other government document
states.absentee: Items required:      Item     . To register to vote online,       step1

states.eligibility: Eligibility to register      Be a U.S. citizen.   Be a resident of Kansas.   Be at least 17 years old (and 18 years old by Election Day to vote).   NOT be disqualified to vote by a court, due to mental incompetence.   NOT be registered to vote in another state.   NOT be incarcerated, on parole or on probation for a felony conviction.
states.online: Items required: A Kansas driver's license or non-driver ID card Proof of your U.S. residency, if registering for the first time . To register to vote online, Visit this website Fillout the online registration form. Scan you proof of citizenship, then email the copy to your county election office
states.inPerson: Items required: Registration form. Proof of U.S. citizenship . To register to vote online, Download this form. Bring the form to your county election officer's office. Please note that the form must be signed. Your county auditor will send you a voter registration card within two weeks if the form is accepted. Pre-registration must be completed 10 days before general elections or 11 days before all other elections.
states.mail: Items required: Registration form. Proof of U.S. citizenship . To register to vote online, Download this form. Mail the form to your county election officer's office. Pre-registration must be completed 10 days before general elections or 11 days before all other elections.

You have not been deemed mentally incompetent and had your voting rights revoked.   NOT have been convicted for a felony.

NOT ot currently incarcerated, on parole, or on probation for a felony conviction.

Currently incarcerated for a felony conviction.

states.inPerson: Items required:      Valid New Hampshire driver's license or identification card     Note that you may register in person at the polling place on election day. In this case, you will be asked to show proof of age, citizenship and domicile.    . To register to vote online,  Otherwise      Apply to your town or city clerk’s office. You will be required to fill out a standard voter registration form and will be required to show proof of age, citizenship and domicile.    It may be easier for you to register with your community’s Supervisors of the Checklist. By law, they are required to meet on the Saturday 10 days prior to each election. Check the local newspaper(s) or call your clerk’s office for the date and time of such meeting.   Complete State of Nevada Mail-In Voter Registration Form.

states.eligibility: Eligibility to register      Be a U.S. citizen for at least one month.   Be an Pennsylvania resident, for at least 30 days before the next election.   Be at least 18 years old.   NOT been convicted of a disqualifying felony.
states.online: Items required: PA driver's liciense or PennDot ID card number or Social security number . To register to vote online, visit this website to register.
states.inPerson: Items required: PA driver's liciense or PennDot ID card number or Social security number . To register to vote online, fill out the Pennsylvania Voter Registration Mail Application Form take the completed form to your county voter registration office Once your voter registration office processes your application, you will be sent a voter identification card by mail. If you do not receive your PA voter ID card within 14 days, you should contact your county voter registration office directly.
states.mail: Items required: PA driver's liciense or PennDot ID card number or Social security number . To register to vote online, fill out the Pennsylvania Voter Registration Mail Application Form send the completed form to your county voter registration office Once your voter registration office processes your application, you will be sent a voter identification card by mail. If you do not receive your PA voter ID card within 14 days, you should contact your county voter registration office directly.
states.absentee: Items required: Registered to vote in the state of Pennsylvania The Absentee ballot must be Received by 5:00 p.m. on the Tuesday before Election Day . To register to vote online, Make sure you're registered to vote in the state of Pennsylvania Go to this website and fill out the form appropriately Send in your application before the 5 p.m. on the Tuesday before Election day

If you do not receive your PA voter ID card within 14 days, you should contact your county voter registration office directly.
